P O Box 68
MULBERRY GROVE, IL 62262

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was no program of veterinary care available during the inspection. There have been previous requests for records
during past inspections on March 2, 2022 and September 22, 2022 which resulted in no records being available. The
licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023 advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were located at
the site 001 so that during inspections they could be looked at by inpsectors.
The program of veterinary care is necessary to acquire proper treamtent and protocols according to the attending
veterinarians directions for the regulated animals.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.
To be corrected by: March 26, 2023

There was no inventory, aquisition, disposition, transportation or brokering records available during the inspection. The
licensee advised that they thought the records were with their spouse in another state and they did not have anything for
inspectors to see. A request was made for the licensee to contact the spouse to determine if they had the records or if
they could advise where they were at, and the licensee advised the spouse was in meetings and not available so they did
not call to check. There have been previous requests for records during past inspections on March 2, 2022 and
September 22, 2022 which resulted in no records being available. The licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023
advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were located at the site 001 so that during inspections they
could be looked at by inpsectors.
The lack of records during inspections does not allow for proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors.
Complete records are needed for proper managment of the regulated animals at a facility and those being brokered,
transported, acquired/held and sold.
Every dealer other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and exhibitor shall make,
keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning animals other
than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under
his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The
records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control.
To be corrected by: March 26 2023

There was no contingency plan made available for inspectors to see during the inspection.
The licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023 advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were
located at the site 001 so that during inspections they could be looked at by inpsectors.
A contingency plan is necessary to provide necessary holding/transport and contacts in the case of an emergency with
the regulated animals at the facility in order to decrease the possible negative affects during an emergency situation.
Dealers, exhibitors, intermediate handlers, and carriers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and
well-being of the animals in their possession).
To be corrected by March 26, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
CHAD PROCTOR, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOREnd Section

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was no program of veterinary care available during the inspection. There have been previous requests for records 
during past inspections on March 2, 2022 and September 22, 2022 which resulted in no records being available. The 
licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023 advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were located at 
the site 001 so that during inspections they could be looked at by inpsectors.  
 
The program of veterinary care is necessary to acquire proper treamtent and protocols according to the attending 
veterinarians directions for the regulated animals. 
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time 
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary 
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor. 
 
To be corrected by: March 26, 2023 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors.

There was no inventory, aquisition, disposition, transportation or brokering records available during the inspection. The 
licensee advised that they thought the records were with their spouse in another state and they did not have anything for 
inspectors to see. A request was made for the licensee to contact the spouse to determine if they had the records or if 
they could advise where they were at, and the licensee advised the spouse was in meetings and not available so they did 
not call to check. There have been previous requests for records during past inspections on March 2, 2022 and 
September 22, 2022 which resulted in no records being available. The licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023 
advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were located at the site 001 so that during inspections they 
could be looked at by inpsectors.  
 
The lack of records during inspections does not allow for proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors. 
Complete records are needed for proper managment of the regulated animals at a facility and those being brokered, 
transported, acquired/held and sold. 
 
Every dealer other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and exhibitor shall make, 
keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information concerning animals other 
than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under 
his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The 
records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. 
 
To be corrected by: March 26 2023 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning.

There was no contingency plan made available for inspectors to see during the inspection.  
 The licensee was emailed on February 6, 2023 advising them to make sure that all records or copies of them were 
located at the site 001 so that during inspections they could be looked at by inpsectors. 
 
A contingency plan is necessary to provide necessary holding/transport and contacts in the case of an emergency with 
the regulated animals at the facility in order to decrease the possible negative affects during an emergency situation. 
 
 Dealers, exhibitors, intermediate handlers, and carriers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to 
provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an 
emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and 
well-being of the animals in their possession). 
 
To be corrected by March 26, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
CHAD PROCTOR, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOREnd Section
